title: Calories in a Carrot Cake
meta_description: Discover calories in a carrot cake, including full nutrition breakdown per serving and total for a standard cake, plus tweaks and FAQs for better choices.
assumptions: Standard 9-inch homemade carrot cake with cream cheese frosting; ~1000 g total weight, serving 12-16 slices; includes walnuts and raisins.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, size, frosting amount, and ingredients; commercial versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard carrot cake contains about 4100 calories total.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of carrot cake?
faqs.a: A typical slice (about 70 g) has ~287 kcal, depending on the recipe.

faqs.q: Is carrot cake high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, a whole standard carrot cake has ~350 g sugars, mostly from frosting and added sweeteners.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a carrot cake?
faqs.a: About 45 g total, mainly from eggs, flour, and nuts.

faqs.q: How does store-bought carrot cake compare?
faqs.a: Often similar or higher in calories due to more frosting; check labels for exact values.
Moderately, with carrots providing some fiber and vitamins, but high fat and sugar make it indulgentâ€”opt for lighter versions.
